title: Bookmarks corrupted
content:
I have lost all my Bookmarks - they have the same name, but the icon & address is wrong.

  • This is on-going = I cannot Bookmark without it occuring.
  • I have attempted to restore to a previous point, but the issue did not resolve.
  • This occurs over all my synced devices. (I have now stopped Firefox syncing.)
  • The incorrect icon & address is from a 'trusted' site (ie. national govt, email provider etc) that I have previously visited, but never Bookmarked.

Please help as I use Bookmarks professionally & have built an excellent database over many years.

- thank you -

title: Usae o navegador em um HD externo
content:
Instalei o Firefox Developer Edition no meu HD externo pois uso o navegador em 2 ou mais computadores diferentes, só que o que está acontecendo é que a configuração do navegador está ficando salva no computador. Consegui criar meu perfil no navegador e salvar ele no HD externo, mas mesmo assim tem algumas configurações que ficam salvas no PC e preciso que fique salva no HD.

Criei o perfil usando o comando "firefox.exe -p", e coloquei a pasta dele no HD externo. Quando vou em "about:profiles" ele aparece lá e diz que está salvo no HD externo.

No "about:cache" em "disk" está salvo no HD externo também. Em cima, na opção "memory" não tem caminho.

Quando abro a pasta "programdata" no PC, tem uma pasta da Mozilla que foi criada, e tem outra em usuários/appdata/local.

Quando desconecto o HD externo e uso em outro computador, ele não encontra mais o usuário. Acredito acontecer isso por causa desses arquivos que ainda estão ficando salvos no PC em vez de estarem no HD.

Segue as imagens: cache, profiles, pasta programdata e pasta user/appdata/local.

A ultima mostra a pasta do meu perfil no HD externo.
creator: contatocamarano

title: Firefox black screen when closing a window
content: When I open a YouTube video in fullscreen in Firefox on my Mac and then attempt to close it using Command + W (without first exiting fullscreen for the youtube video), a new blackish/dark grey window briefly appears before disappearing (3-5 seconds) with no controls and is fully unresponsive. I have changed only 1 setting in about:config to full-screen-api. macos-native-full-screen to true to prevent other monitors from going black (known issue). This does not happen in any other browsers. Could you please tell me how I can resolve this issue?

title: Linux: High CPU usage when interacting with Firefox (scrolling, moving mouse, Youtube...)
content:
Hi

Not sure when exactly this started but I guess in last or last 2 updates. I have Legion 5 with Ryzen 7 and Nvidia 1650Ti GPU, installed latest GPU drivers and using Ubuntu 22.04.

So the problem is CPU usage with Firefox. Whatever I do the CPU usage spikes to around 50%, sometimes even more. I tried with Safe mode but it's the same. Task manager just shows the same info I see in System Monitor app, the tab which is active is using a lot of CPU for basic tasks.

I enabled Hardware acceleration and in `about:support` for Compositing section it says `Webrender` so I guess the hardware acceleration is turned on properly, but by looking at the System Monitor app it seems like GPU is not used.

If someone has idea what to try next it would be great, thanks.
creator: alenn

title: Screen Glitches only in Firefox browser Slows PC so much forces me to reboot
content:
Ever since a couple of Firefox updates ago (been about 2-3 weeks), Firefox will screw up and start putting pieces of the page I'm on all over my screen. It comes out of nowhere on all different sites (it has happened 6 times and all were different sites), but it usually is only once a day though tonight it happened twice within an hour. Moving the mouse all over the place makes it worse with more copies. It also slows all response from my computer to several seconds no matter what I try (closing the browser, opening task manager, etc). Sometimes I can get to the reboot screen and do it there, but most of the time everything is so slow I have to hit the power button on my HP which is the standby or sleep button so when I hit it again, I am at the login screen and can reboot there.

As I said, a single reboot normally solves the problem for the rest of the day or several days until tonight. I have a basic wired scroll mouse that I'm wondering if pressing down on it is causing Firefox to glitch. Otherwise, I've got no idea. Firefox has updated to 119, Windows 11 has updated a couple of times, my NVIDIA GeForce card driver updates weekly. I have no malware or viruses on my PC. Nothing is pulling hard on my resources as it only pulls 40% of my memory max when checking it in Task Manager when I can get it to open.
creator: scott_smart2000

title: windows taskbar doesn't disappear in firefox fullscreen
content:
When I go into fullscreen, by any means (F11 or dedicated button next to zoom settings), only the firefox toolbar disappears. The window taskbar stays there. Issue is not present on other installed browsers.

I tried: - Troubleshoot mode - Tinkering with windows accessibility settings for Firefox - On troubleshoot mode, Individually flipping these configs (+ refresh): - - browser.fullscreen.autohide - - browser.link.open_newwindow.disabled_in_fullscreen - - browser.link.open_newwindow.disabled_in_fullscreen - - widget.windows.fullscreen_remind_taskbar
